job_description.job_summary:
We are seeking candidates with numerical and analytical skills to join our market leading administrative team. Previous music copyright, office and admin experience is essential.

We are currently looking for:

A Senior Copyright Assistant to help manage our catalogue within the United Kingdom.
This is an office-based, administrative role that will require a hardworking, detail-oriented and organized individual.
job_description.background: The primary roles of a copyright department are registering claims to songs at the relevant collection societies globally and processing the royalties which result from the exploitation of those songs. This enables us to collect and distribute royalties due to the copyright owners.

duties: Processing royalty statements received from collection societies.
Analysing the royalties received to identify possible underpayment or delayed payment, and working with the societies to resolve these issues.
Processing new works and agreements as the company acquires rights to new catalogues.
Ensuring works and agreements are registered correctly at the collection societies.
Handling song disputes and duplicate claims.
Dealing with general enquiries regarding our claims to works and the terms of our publishing agreements.
You may be asked to take on extra responsibilities – please be aware that the above list is not exhaustive.
